com.concordium.sdk.transactions

Class TransactionHeaderV1

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.concordium.sdk.transactions.TransactionHeaderV1

  • public class TransactionHeaderV1
extends Object
    The transaction header used for the extended transaction format, used for AccountTransactionV1.

      • calculateMaxEnergyCost

        public static UInt64 calculateMaxEnergyCost(int senderSignatureCount,
                                            int sponsorSignatureCount,
                                            int payloadSize,
                                            UInt64 transactionSpecificCost)
        Calculate the maximum amount of energy that can be spent on executing a transaction.
        Parameters:
        senderSignatureCount - number of signatures by the sender in the transaction (TransactionSigner.size())
        sponsorSignatureCount - number of signatures by the sponsor in the transaction (TransactionSigner.size())
        payloadSize - size of the transaction payload in bytes
        transactionSpecificCost - cost of the specific transaction (payload) type
        Returns:
        the energy cost for the transaction, to be set in the transaction header.
        See Also:
        TransactionTypeCost

      • builder

        public static TransactionHeaderV1.TransactionHeaderV1Builder builder()

      • getSender

        @NonNull
public @NonNull AccountAddress getSender()
        The address of the account that is the source of the transaction.

      • getNonce

        @NonNull
public @NonNull Nonce getNonce()
        The sequence number of the transaction, sender (source) account nonce. Transactions executed on an account must have sequential sequence numbers, starting from 1.

      • getMaxEnergyCost

        @NonNull
public @NonNull UInt64 getMaxEnergyCost()
        The amount of energy allocated for executing this transaction. This is the maximum amount of energy that can be spent on executing this transaction.
        See Also:
        calculateMaxEnergyCost(int, int, int, UInt64)

      • getPayloadSize

        @NonNull
public @NonNull UInt32 getPayloadSize()
        The size of the transaction payload in bytes.

      • getExpiry

        @NonNull
public @NonNull Expiry getExpiry()
        A Unix timestamp indicating when the transaction should expire. A transaction cannot be included in a block with a timestamp later than the transactionâ€™s expiry time.
